arm_group.description: Irrigation of fistula tract with 1% silver nitrate solution for all patients who accepts the study and signed the written informed consent form.

brief_summary.textblock:
Effectiveness of silver nitrate solution in treatment of anal fistula is is aimed to be
      investigated.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Silver Nitrate Solution in the Treatment of Anal Fistula

detailed_description.textblock:
The anal fistula is a granulation tissue-lined tract, we thought of a way to ablate this
      granulation tissue using a chemical agent, which would eventually induce healing with
      fibrosis and closure of the tract without any surgical intervention. Aiming to reduce the
      surgery related complications; we investigated the effectiveness of silver nitrate solution
      as a chemical agent in the treatment of anal fistula.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

        All patients with the diagnosis of anal fistula Patients with recurrence

        Exclusion Criteria:

        Patients who do not sign the informed consent

study_pop.textblock: Patients with the diagnosis of anal fistula

clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Silver Nitrate Solution in the Treatment of Anal Fistula: A Novel Strategy for Managing Anal Fistula

primary_outcome.description: The primary end point in the study was to assess the efficacy of the silver nitrate in the treatment of anal fistula. The number of anal fistula patients who are treated with silver nitrate solution will be calculated. The role of silver nitrate solution in anal fistula treatment will be investigated
primary_outcome.measure: Number of anal fistula patients treated with silver nitrate solution.

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: The secondary end point was to identify the clinical and therapeutic factors that significantly affect the primary endpoint.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Cohort, Time Perspective: Prospective
